attributes.action: Start an investigation into the astronomical cost of the UK Track and Trace.
attributes.additional_details: As the government is the body that has given the go ahead for this astronomical amount, they should publically investigate what on earth £22 billion has been spent on and then justify this incredible use of public money.
attributes.background: The cost of implementing Track and Trace in the UK is approximately £22 billion pound. This is an incredibly large amount, especially when you consider that NASA can send the Perseverance Rover to Mars for 'just' £3 billion.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/555502

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/
